metadata.name: Suspicious Use of CSharp Interactive Console
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\csi.exe')) AND (endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\pwsh.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\powershell_ise.exe'))) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('csi.exe'))

output.summary: Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell

metadata.objective: False positive: Possible depending on environment. Pair with other factors such as net connections, command-line args, etc. Reference: https://redcanary.com/blog/detecting-attacks-leveraging-the-net-framework/
